# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

You can achieve this by using Julia's `Threads` module. Below is an implementation of the `pig_latinify` function:

```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latin(word::String)
    if isempty(word)
        return word
    end
    first_letter = word[1]
    
    if first_letter in "aeiouAEIOU"
        return word * "way"
    else
        return word[2:end] * first_letter * "ay"
    end
end

function pig_latinify(words::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    result = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))
    @threads for i in 1:length(words)
        result[i] = pig_latin(words[i])
    end
    return result
end
```

### Usage:

```julia
words = ["hello", "world", "this", "is", "pig", "latin"]
latin_words = pig_latinify(words)
println(latin_words)
```

This will run the Pig Latin transformation in parallel for each word in the input vector. Each thread processes one word.
